taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [for Johann A. F. Eichhorn, 1779–1856, Prussian statesman]

bio:treatment.discussion: Eichhornia paniculata (Sprengel) Solms-Laubach [syn. Piaropus paniculatus (Sprengel) Small] was reported by J. K. Small (1913) as occurring in drainage ditches of peninsular Florida. The collection was made in 1907 in Manatee County (J. K. Small s.n., NY). This species can be recognized by its growing rooted in mud and by the presence of cordate leaves and an elongate flowering stem terminated by a panicule of 20–100 flowers.
Eichhornia diversifolia (Vahl) Urban, native to Puerto Rico, is not known to occur in the flora area.

references.reference: Barrett, S. C. H. 1988. Evolution of breeding systems in Eichhornia (Pontederiaceae): A review. Ann. Missouri Bot. Gard. 75: 741–760.
